title: According to Mahayana, is Buddha immortal? - Quora

response.answer_text: A person is always impermanent, but the Life of person is a cycle of Birth and Death. Birth&Death means that the current person cannot repeat, because each Rebirth is new. The word Buddha has 2 meanings: a person who attained enlightenment,a state of enlightenment of wisdom & compassion. (Buddha-state of mind)While a person is temporary, the STATE of enlightenment is eternal. Think of it as LOVE. Love existed all over the ages. No one “invents love”. We experience it. The same with Enlightenment. The Buddha did not “invent” Enlightenment. He did not “invent” the State of Buddhahood. He just aligned his life to the life of the universe - and became in perfect harmony with the universal state of wisdom and compassion. The Buddha did not invent Compassion or Wisdom. These are eternal qualities of Life. Mahayana teaches that all you have to do is to be in harmony with your true nature (which is the Enlightened nature or the Buddhanature of compassion and wisdom). Mahayana teaches that you too has the same potential of enlightenment as the Buddha. It teaches you to trust yourself that you are not inferior and that you deserve the highest quality of a human being, which Shakyamuni manifested as our role model. The cycle of Birth&Death is eternal, and if you make your aim to attain enlightenment, then you yourself will become a Buddha in each lifetime, not that of great world-wide mission (with the media speaking about you) - but as you are, in your simple life in family or society, a happy and reasonable person leading others to happiness. This is manifesting the Buddha-state: “If we attain the state of Buddhahood in this lifetime, that state will forever pervade our lives. Throughout the cycle of birth and death in each new lifetime we will be endowed with good health, wealth and intelligence along with a supportive and comfortable environment, leading a life that overflows with good fortune. Each of us will also possess a unique mission and be born in an appropriate form to fulfil it”.(Nichiren Buddhism, Ikeda: Faith into Action page 23)

There no only two Tradition of bhuddhism i.e Sanskrit Tradition & Pali Tradition. The Word Mahayana you referring to is a Sanskrit Tradition. The source of that institution was Nalanda in Bihar. Buddha or teacher means once you able to uproot all your mental kalesha through the direct realisation of Shunyata or emptiness and Bodhichitta. It seems your questions is, is Siddharth Gautam Buddha is immortal? According to Sanskrit Tradition bhuddhism, Siddharth Gautam Buddha is a fourth Buddha and he will remain as long as this universe exist. After that new Buddha will come once the new universes is born. Bhuddhism belive in thousands multiples of big bangs. Buddhism also believe in different millions of World like Earth and realms. So definitely, yes Siddarth Gautam Buddha is immortal now and in next universe even if may be under different Buddha as a teacher. He will still be immortal because Bhuddhism doesn't believe in Atman but in consciousness. So his consciousness will be permanent and busy helping sentient beings in some other different world. 🙏🙏🙏

Buddha bathed in the shower of elixir Amrita on attaining the Samadhi and became immortal. All yogis experience the shower at enlightenment and become immortal. The immortality signifies the forever existence of the conscious mind of Buddha beyond body demise. The shower signify rain of light droplets, knowledge that removes darkness of ignorance and provide enlightenment. The range power of enlightened spirit is infinite. The extent of learning until death limits the range of power of other spirits.

Sutrapridot 3:107 BC 483 Buddha on his deathbed taught that there would be a future Messiah,”Lord of Mercies” who would be able to free men of their sins. His name shall be called,” The King of Kings, the Lord of Lords”. He is all knowing, all wise. He knows all that is in the human heart. He is Lord of all the angels and of all Humans. No one is greater than He. So Buddha believed the Messiah. So he must be saved(immortal). CV. Varghese

Buddha means pure intelligence. Every thing apoears and dissolves in that Pure intelligence. Pure intelligence is neither the person nor it has any relation with the person.. Mortals get created and Die. Pure intelligence never got created, thus no question of dying… its eternal. This pure intelligence is nothing but awareness only. Mahayana is a sanskrit word. In sanskrit every alphabet and every combination of alphabets within every word has a meaning. Thus meaning of every word lies within that word. Ma means “I am" Ha means “is there" Ya means “this (body and creation)” Na means “not" Maha means “greatest" Yana means “vehicle which uplifts” Mahayana is abiding as, “I am there, wherein this (body and creation) is not". This is a greatest practice which uplifts u.
No . Only Truth is immortal . But a Buddha realises that there is nothing but Truth alone . Non duality .
Not by body but by thoughts Buddha is immortal !!!
